adjective.description: Of notes: heavily accented and left before their full time has expired; percussive. Of a note, passage, etc.: played in this style.

noun.description: Martellato style of playing or musical direction.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in John Stainer (1840–1901), musicologist and composer. From Italian martellato, past participle of martellare to hammer.
